Listen, so ideally I'd have every Harry Potter book and movie remade to include gay characters, but that's not going to happen. I still love what we have. I'm not going to review an upcoming movie that no one has seen, so I'll come back to this issue in November.

@chrls_t1 @anxietyqueen84 @amandabarrie11 I'm happy to agree to disagree. I think we had a good discussion. I look forward to it too, because Courtney has used every show she's ever appeared on to discuss equality to some degree, from Australian Idol to RuPaul's Drag Race.

@chrls_t1 @anxietyqueen84 @amandabarrie11 Yes, it doesn't matter how long ago she voted as long as she maintains those views now. Everyone in there has some sort of agenda. Shane's is political discussion and raising awareness which is a wonderful objective. Ignoring the voices of oppression only strengthen them.

@chrls_t1 @anxietyqueen84 @amandabarrie11 It's clear he wants to keep public attention focused on it, which is a good thing considering the rise in homophobic rheroric Europe has seen recently. And by talking about it again, he's underlining the importance of political discussion, which Amanda tried to shut down.

@chrls_t1 @anxietyqueen84 @amandabarrie11 I have to disagree. As a member of the LGBTQ community, Shane knows how important it is to inform wider society about the difficulties faced by queer people. Ann's votes against marriage equality continued a long history of marginalising queer people and he's right to bring it up
Do you remember the years when PokÃ©mon dominated pop culture and we weren't facing the prospect of nuclear war every day? Good times.
Whereas most of the others in that house are trivializing the importance of political debate. Cowards.

@courtneyact is such a fabulous voice for the LGBTQ+ community. To hear her speak so coherently on mainstream TV is just amazing. She's literally saving young queer lives every time she opens her mouth.
I will defend my compulsive viewing of Drag Race and Big Brother to the end.
Wow I've become such a reality tv whore. This is what leaving college has done to me.
RT @AlexWJSimpson: @Rylan I know that if 16-year-old me had seen Shane J speak on these issues in such a way, it would have been a shiningâ€¦

@anxietyqueen84 @amandabarrie11 I think that's a nice sentiment, but I don't think anyone should ignore a person's actions in the past when forming an opinion of them. Ann campaigned for decades against the LGBTQ community and caused great harm by doing so. Shane's recognition of that fact is important.
Meditation is honestly one of the best things to ever happen to me.

Kaur reminds me of many amazing women and men I met in college who are all working their asses off to represent themselves as individuals and our entire generation through their poetry. I can't wait to see what these people produce in the years ahead.

There are so many people who try to shit over Kaur's achievements and I don't think they're worth listening to. She's part of a new generation of poets, and the fact that older critics/artists roll their eyes is evidence of the gen x mindset that plunged us into recession in 2007
Just finished milk and honey by @rupikaur_ and I think I've fallen in love with a woman for the first time in my life. What a talent.
